body_html:
there is some in the reparameterization type doc. generally when calculating score functions, you have to perform

tf.gradients(q.log_prob(tf.stop_gradients(z)), mu)

i agree having to be aware of how the sampling mechanism is implemented can be unintuitive. both use cases—taking gradients through samples or not through samples—are useful though.

body:
there is some in the reparameterization type doc. generally when calculating score functions, you have to perform
```python
tf.gradients(q.log_prob(tf.stop_gradients(z)), mu)
```
i agree having to be aware of how the sampling mechanism is implemented can be unintuitive. both use cases—taking gradients through samples or not through samples—are useful though.
